headline: Developmental stage-specific and intestinal expression profile of a Cryptosporidium parvum gene
one_paragraph_summary:
Transcriptomic studies reveal the expression profile of a gene in Cryptosporidium parvum, showcasing developmental stage-specific and tissue-specific dynamics:
  • The gene exhibits notably elevated expression in intracellular stages relative to oocysts, as well as significant expression changes through infection stages, peaking at 24-hour post-infection.
  • High expression levels were observed in calf intestine samples compared to sporozoites, suggesting intestinal tissue-specific upregulation.
  • The expression increases significantly during infection, with dynamic changes at different time points post-infection, pointing to a potentially active role in parasitic development inside hosts.
These observations hint at a biologically vital functional role related to intracellular parasitism and host interaction.

topics.headline: Expression dynamics during parasite development in intracellular stages
topics.one_sentence_summary: This gene demonstrates significantly increased expression in intracellular stages of Cryptosporidium parvum compared to other lifecycle stages across various experimental setups.

topics.headline: Tissue-specific expression levels during host infection
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows high expression in calf intestinal tissue, compared to lower levels in sporozoites and infected cells, indicating tissue specificity in C. parvum.
